name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, ezcmac, fosters, shammack, Moraiat, pzukowski, Howard, tommycrashwreck, lk, nutmeg, dropkickpikachu)

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, tending to a "stew"-smeared comrade is pretty much the apex of straight male bonding.

name: straw
text: Not as much as going out and getting a plunger because you are too drunk to drive and he is too drunk to be conscious

name: jhunter
text: I think I truly knew my best friend was my best friend when I was helping him vomit into my sink and mopping up what missed the sink with nary a word of complaint

name: hawaiian_robot
text: I salute you!

name: bordello
text: That's how I realized my best friend was my best friend too.

name: tasteful
text: that is how paris hilton's My Best Friend ended

name: sex_bicycle
text: yeah friendship truely is cemented by drunken vomiting in sinks my friend even washed my hair after <3

name: greenkoolayd
text: thats heartwarming

name: mastronaut
text: I like how asherdan has set up his reputation of being an asshole so soundly that all of his comments are lamed to oblivion, even if he is being an okay guy.

name: tipist
text: Type 5 stew?

name: tipist
text: I'll try this again... Type 5 stew?

name: radchillies
text: chubbied for the sheer dedication to research

name: rowboat
text:
Type 7, obviously.

Also, what the HELL is wrong with British people? This probably took a lot of work and money and it just didn't need to be done at all!

name: atypicaloracle
text: Actually, it probably takes a lot less time to write "frequent Type 7 stool" than "patient describes pissing brown liquid out of his rectum for three to four minutes at a time whilst being compelled to sing various ad-libbed songs, in the manner of Negro Spirituals, regarding how his over-indulgence in tequila has resulted in the Almighty having completely given him over to the forces of faecal Hell."

name: rowboat
text:
You know, I can't argue with that.

Incidentally, I've been off the red meat for a few weeks now and have become a complete Type 6 Man. I was expecting more 3, but a dude could do worse than 6 after all of that 2.

name: j_a_s_e
text:
I have a friend who leaves his 'stew' for kicks! He says its to conserve water... maybe Ray is just environmentally conscious.
At least Beef didnt have to shield Rays pecker with a toilet roll to get him off the toilet this time.

name: bixschmix
text: You are mistaken. That is not a friend.

name: madnes
text: A comment left by madnes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by haff, trevor, lateadopter)

name: howard
text: Not any more!

name: trevor
text:
I think you mean "Lady in the radiator song".

Which is from the movie "Eraserhead" but the Pixies sung it.

name: straw
text: I was fine with that movie up until the Lady in the Radiator

name: trevor
text: What? She was my favorite part!

name: nutmeg
text: her cheeks make no damn sense!

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, Overmedicated, tttt)

name: stuart
text: As opposed to the rest of the movie, which was perfectly logical

name: godfatherofsouls
text: it makes her look more like a skull-- she represents death

name: rowboat
text: I know that it's Lynch and this can be pointlessly debated for a lifetime, but I've convinced myself that death (or at least Badness in general) was represented by the Man in the Planet. The Lady in the Radiator seemed like more of an angel. Or at worst that she represented a kind of peaceful death. Whatever she is, it's clear that she's in opposition to The Man in the Planet, and therefore cannot be too bad, as he is quite obviously a demonic being and blah blah blah blah .

name: godfatherofsouls
text:
Aye, she's a goodly being because death is what Henry wants, but I always saw the man in the planet as god, pulling the levers and observing and such.. At the end when things go all sparky and he finally joins the lady, I figured that to be him dying.
but like you said-- it's Lynch.

name: nutmeg
text: i love all of you for debating Lynch. just letting you know what's up.

name: joamiq
text: Yes, but you get a chubby anyway. You know why.

name: everything_is_a_hat
text:
Where's your underpants!
In heaven!

name: anathan
text:
No, not Monkey Gone to Heaven, "In Heaven (Lady in the Radiator song)"

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v_YuLOHjF7E]

name: deancain29
text: Best line ever - "Man things aint never the same once you seen a dude's stew"

name: m-e-charm
text: Classic.

name: lawdog
text: The thunder of Ray's stew resounds through Beef's brain even to this day.

name: zedpower
text: I'm kind of surprised that this is the first time he's seen Ray's stew.

name: zzzleepy
text: totes agree with you.  all of ray's shennanigans and this is the first time?  i dunno...

name: blarghamagarky
text: Ray is kind of classy (or at least perceives himself to be) to let dudes just see his stew

name: mattylite
text: Could be that it isn't the first time.  Maybe Beef has seen it so many times he's de-sensitized, and he's saying things have changed in that since his stew-seeing cherry was already so popped, now he doesn't mind helping his friend out of the rough chuckles he's gotten himself into.

name: honesttom
text: "Things ain't never the same once you seen a dude's stew" is one of my mottos by which I live my life.

name: hypoluxa
text: This is the line that got me totally convinced that this is the best comic ever created.

name: farqussus
text: i can no longer eat stew.

name: catgrl131
text: It's a god-what-the-fuck-was-I-doing Monday!

name: jezebel
text:
Would you know my name
If I saw you in heaven?
Would it be the same
If I saw you in heaven?

Underpants in heaven.

And now I'm going to hell for imagining this blasphemous twist to a song about Eric Clapton's deceased son. I'm going to burn to crispiness.

name: theirateturk
text: I've seen a friend's turd (Hey, come here a sec!) and this is definitely something which has contributed to my emotional problems

name: echidnaboy
text:
Whe-e-e-e-ere is Ray?

To the tune of "Where is Love?" from "Oliver!"

name: clintisiceman
text: I agree with Roast Beef's sentiment. That was a weird moment for me. I honestly think it might've been less weird if I had seen his dick or something.

name: tekende
text:
Hey you know what's even better is seeing your girlfriend's stew

And commenting on how little it is

And then she tells you not to make fun of her poop

It...it seemed a normal situation at the time.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Girls HATE it when you make fun of their Seconds. My old roommate used to try to kind of sneak away to crap, and if I walked by the bathroom, I'd always go "DAAAAAMN that STINKS up ins!" or something similarly inane, but she took it very seriously and would get pissed off, every time, for 6 years.

She also hid all of her farts from me, except for one time: she walked into another room to fart, but I got up to go to the kitchen and walked right into the cloud, figured it out, and she weakly tried to deny it.

name: wilbur
text:
Man, if I was Beef I wouldn't even let Ray back in the Galaxie after lying on that bathroom floor. He'd have to get hosed down by like a 6000 PSI pressure washer before that happened.

But then I guess I'm just not as good a friend as Beef is.

name: daidai
text: Oh shit. Ray is totally singing to the tune of "Where Is Love" from Oliver. He has to be. It is too perfect not to be.

name: housewife
text:
Man Ray's photography is pretty excellent.

"man ray you a shambles"

name: tekende
text: Photography?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
It's yet another comment/joke on how Beef's common starter phrase "man ray..." can be confused with the surrealist artist/photographer/filmmaker Man Ray .

It pops up every once in a while on assetbar.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: oh. so...not like this, then?

name: rowboat
text: I've been guilty of it once. It was a long time ago. If I'd known that it was going to happen every time the words "man ray" were mentioned, I wouldn't have bit. I guess I should have realized that it was bound to happen. It's pretty obvious.
